table. &#160;Please refer to our cautionary statement regarding third party information at the beginning of this MD&amp;A. &#160;There can be no assurance that production estimates received from our operators will be achieved. &#160;Please also refer to our cautionary language regarding forward-looking statements following this MD&amp;A, as well as the Risk Factors identified in Part&#160;I,&#160;Item 1A, of our Fiscal 2019 10-K for information regarding factors that could affect actual results.</span></td></tr></table><p style="font-family:'Times New and represent Barrick&#8217;s 60% interest in Pueblo Viejo. &#160;The operator did not provide estimated or actual silver production. </span></td></tr></table><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="font-size:4pt;visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><table style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;table-layout:fixed;text-align:justify;width:100%;border:0pt;"><tr><td style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:6.75pt;vertical-align:top;white-space:nowrap;width:18pt;padding:0pt;">(6)</td><td style="padding:0pt;"><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:9pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-align:justify;">The estimated and actual production figures shown for Rainy River are produced gold and silver in dor&#233;.</span></td></tr></table><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="font-size:4pt;visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><table style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;table-layout:fixed;text-align:justify;width:100%;border:0pt;"><tr><td style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:6.75pt;vertical-align:top;white-space:nowrap;width:18pt;padding:0pt;">(7)</td><td style="padding:0pt;"><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:9pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-align:justify;">The estimated and actual production figures shown for Wassa are payable gold in dor&#233;. &#160; </span></td></tr></table><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="font-size:4pt;visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><table style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;table-layout:fixed;text-align:justify;width:100%;border:0pt;"><tr><td style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:6.75pt;vertical-align:top;white-space:nowrap;width:18pt;padding:0pt;">(8)</td><td style="padding:0pt;"><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:9pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-align:justify;">The estimated and actual gold and silver production figures shown for </span><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:9pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-align:justify;">Pe&#241;asquito</span><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:9pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-align:justify;"> are payable gold and silver in concentrate and dor&#233;. &#160;The estimated lead and zinc production figures shown are payable lead and zinc in concentrate. &#160;The estimated production figures shown are for the period April 18, 2019 through December 31, 2019, while actual production figures shown are for the </span></td></tr></table></div><div style="clear:both;display:table;margin-bottom:27.35pt;min-height:36pt;width:100%;"><div style="display:table-cell;vertical-align:bottom;width:100%;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:center;margin:24pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;">23</p></div></div></div>
<div style="background-color:#000000;clear:both;height:2pt;page-break-after:always;width:79.3%;border:0;margin:30pt 10.35% 30pt 10.35%;"></div><div style="max-width:100%;padding-left:10.35%;padding-right:10.35%;position:relative;"><div style="margin-top:21.6pt;min-height:41.75pt;width:100%;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 0pt 30pt 0pt;"><a href="#Toc"><span style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-align:left;">Table of Contents</span></a></p></div><div style="clear:both;max-width:100%;position:relative;"><table style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;table-layout:fixed;text-align:justify;width:100%;border:0pt;"><tr><td style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:6.75pt;vertical-align:top;white-space:nowrap;width:18pt;padding:0pt;"></td><td style="padding:0pt;"><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:9pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-align:justify;">period April 18, 2019 through September 30, 2019, per the operator. Full calendar year 2019 information was not available from the operator as of the date of this report. &#160;</span></td></tr></table><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><b style="font-weight:bold;">Property Developments </b></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="font-weight:bold;visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">The following property development information is provided by the operators of the properties, either to Royal Gold or in various documents made publicly available.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="background-color:#ffff00;visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="text-decoration:underline;text-decoration-color:#000000;">Stream Interests</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><i style="font-style:italic;">Andacollo </i></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="background-color:#ffff00;visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Gold stream deliveries from Andacollo were approximately 18,600 ounces of gold for the three months ended December 31, 2019, compared to approximately 10,700 ounces of gold for the three months ended December 31, 2018. Increased deliveries resulted from differences in the timing of shipments and settlements during the periods. </p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">On October 13, 2019, Teck reported the Teck Carmen de Andacollo Workers Union gave notice that a strike would commence on October 14, 2019. &#160;Operations were suspended with the exception of essential activities required to maintain safety and the environment. &#160;On December 5, 2019, Teck reported the Workers Union ratified a new 36-month collective agreement and operations had resumed. &#160;We anticipate the impact of the strike to be reflected in our financial results beginning with the quarter ended June 30, 2020, as we generally receive gold deliveries from Andacollo within six months of concentrate shipment.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><i style="font-style:italic;">Khoemac</i><i style="font-style:italic;text-decoration:underline;text-decoration-color:#000000;">a</i><i style="font-style:italic;">u Copper Silver Project</i></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">According to Khoemac<span style="text-decoration:underline;text-decoration-color:#000000;">a</span>u Copper Mining (Pty.) Limited (&#8220;KCM&#8221;), progress continued at the Khoemac<span style="text-decoration:underline;text-decoration-color:#000000;">a</span>u Project (&#8220;Khoemac<span style="text-decoration:underline;text-decoration-color:#000000;">a</span>u&#8221;) in Botswana. &#160;According to KCM, the project reached approximately 26% of construction completion at the end of the December 2019 quarter with 77% of the capital committed. Also, according to KCM, there are approximately 1,400 workers currently on site, with activities focused on completing excavation of the boxcuts, construction of accommodation, power and water infrastructure at Zone 5, completing construction of the access road between Zone 5 and the Boseto mill, and refurbishment of the Boseto mill. &#160;The mining contractor has been mobilized and much of the underground mining fleet has arrived on site and is being commissioned, with handover of the first boxcut from KCM to the contractor scheduled to begin in early February 2020, which is delayed from previous estimates due to a slower than planned excavation advance, partially caused by excess surface water accumulation in the boxcuts during the current rainy season.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Royal Gold has made two advance payments under the Khoemac<span style="text-decoration:underline;text-decoration-color:#000000;">a</span>u stream agreement: $65.8 million on November 5, 2020, and $22 million on February 5, 2020. &#160;Royal Gold&#8217;s remaining commitment ranges from $124.2 million for the base stream of 80% of payable silver up to $177.2 million should KCM elect to increase the stream from 80% to 100% of payable silver. &#160;Further payments are subject to certain conditions and are scheduled to be made on a quarterly basis using an agreed formula and certification process as project spending progresses. </p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">KCM continues to expect the first shipment of concentrate by mid-calendar 2021.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="background-color:#ffff00;visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><i style="font-style:italic;">Mount Milligan </i></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Gold stream deliveries from Mount Milligan were approximately 18,800 ounces of gold for the three months ended December 31, 2019, compared to approximately 10,300 ounces of gold for the three months ended December 31, 2018. Increased deliveries resulted from differences in the timing of shipments.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"> &#160;<span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Copper stream deliveries from Mount Milligan were approximately 4.4 million pounds during the three months ended December 31, 2019, compared to approximately 2.5 million pounds during the three months ended December 31, 2018. Increased deliveries resulted from differences in the timing of shipments.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">On October 30, 2019, Centerra reported it is preparing an updated 43-101 technical report on the Mount Milligan mine that will incorporate changes to long-term gold recoveries, operating costs, optimization studies and exploration drilling. &#160;The expected timing for publication of this report is within the coming months. &#160;Centerra expects a material reduction in the mineral reserves and mineralized material at Mount Milligan, although it has acknowledged that the extent of any </p></div><div style="clear:both;display:table;margin-bottom:27.35pt;min-height:36pt;width:100%;"><div style="display:table-cell;vertical-align:bottom;width:100%;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:center;margin:24pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;">24</p></div></div></div>
<div style="background-color:#000000;clear:both;height:2pt;page-break-after:always;width:79.3%;border:0;margin:30pt 10.35% 30pt 10.35%;"></div><div style="max-width:100%;padding-left:10.35%;padding-right:10.35%;position:relative;"><div style="margin-top:21.6pt;min-height:41.75pt;width:100%;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 0pt 30pt 0pt;"><a href="#Toc"><span style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-align:left;">Table of Contents</span></a></p></div><div style="clear:both;max-width:100%;position:relative;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">changes in reserves and mineralized material cannot be precisely determined until all relevant studies and modeling have been completed. &#160;</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">A significant reduction in reserves and mineralized material could be an indicator of potential impairment for Royal Gold&#8217;s stream interest. &#160;The financial impairment taken by Centerra does not impact the mine operating performance, and, further, a significant reduction in reserves and mineralized material at Mount Milligan may not result in an impairment given current high gold prices and our low depletion rates ($402 per ounce of gold and $0.81 per pound of copper) for the Mount Milligan stream interest. &#160;It is unclear at this point what impact, if any, the results of Centerra&#8217;s updated 43-101 technical report will have on the carrying value of our stream interest at Mount Milligan. &#160;The Company will continue to monitor these developments at Mount Milligan in subsequent quarterly reporting periods.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><i style="font-style:italic;">Pueblo Viejo</i></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Gold stream deliveries from Pueblo Viejo were approximately 13,200 ounces of gold for the three months ended December 31, 2019, compared to approximately 10,400 ounces of gold for the three months ended December 31, 2018. Lower deliveries in the December 2018 quarter were due to a change from deliveries based on provisional assays from the refinery to final assays.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"> <span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Silver stream deliveries were approximately 417,700 ounces of silver for the three months ended December 31, 2019, compared to approximately 469,000 ounces of silver for the three months ended December 31, 2018. Lower deliveries were primarily the result of lower silver grades during the current quarter.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Barrick has been advancing a plant expansion pre-feasibility study at Pueblo Viejo, including a fatal flaw analysis for additional tailings capacity, and targeted completion of the study for the end of calendar 2019. &#160;If positive, a feasibility study of the expansion is expected to be completed during calendar 2020. &#160;Barrick expects the plant expansion project could significantly increase throughput and allow the mine to maintain average annual gold production of approximately 800,000 ounces after calendar 2022 (on a 100% basis).</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="background-color:#ffff00;visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><i style="font-style:italic;">Rainy River</i></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="font-style:italic;visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Gold stream deliveries from Rainy River were approximately 4,200 ounces of gold for the three months ended December 31, 2019, compared to approximately 4,500 ounces of gold for the three months ended December 31, 2018.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"> &#160;<span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Silver stream deliveries were approximately 48,100 ounces of silver for the three months ended December 31, 2019, compared to approximately 41,700 ounces of silver for the three months ended December 31, 2018.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><a id="_Hlk30256568"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">New Gold reported total gold production of 51,000 ounces for the current quarter and average mill throughput of approximately 22,500 tonnes per day for the December 2019 quarter, including average throughput of approximately 24,800 tonnes per day for November and December 2019, exceeding the target range of 24,000 tonnes per day and original design of 21,000 tonnes per day. &#160;New Gold also reported that mill availability averaged 89% for the current quarter and gold recovery averaged 91%, in line with plan.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">During the quarter ended December 31, 2019, New Gold reported that it continued to advance a comprehensive mine optimization study that includes a review of alternative open pit and underground mining scenarios, and it expects to release the results of this study on February 13, 2020. &#160;A significant reduction in reserves and mineralized material could be an indicator of potential impairment for Royal Gold&#8217;s stream interest. &#160;It is unclear at this point what impact, if any, the results of New Gold&#8217;s optimization study and any updates to the reserves and mineralized material at Rainy River will have on the carrying value of our stream interest. &#160;As of December 31, 2019, the Company&#8217;s depletion rate for its interest at Rainy River was $591 per ounce of gold and $6.34 per ounce of silver production. The Company will continue to monitor these developments. </p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><i style="font-style:italic;">Wassa</i></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Gold stream deliveries from Wassa were approximately 4,900 ounces of gold for the three months ended December 31, 2019, compared to approximately 3,600 ounces of gold for the three months ended December 31, 2018. The improvement in deliveries is related to improved gold grades. &#160;Wassa delivered grades of 3.78 grams per tonne during the current quarter, </p></div><div style="clear:both;display:table;margin-bottom:27.35pt;min-height:36pt;width:100%;"><div style="display:table-cell;vertical-align:bottom;width:100%;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:center;margin:24pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;">25</p></div></div></div>
<div style="background-color:#000000;clear:both;height:2pt;page-break-after:always;width:79.3%;border:0;margin:30pt 10.35% 30pt 10.35%;"></div><div style="max-width:100%;padding-left:10.35%;padding-right:10.35%;position:relative;"><div style="margin-top:21.6pt;min-height:41.75pt;width:100%;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 0pt 30pt 0pt;"><a href="#Toc"><span style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-align:left;">Table of Contents</span></a></p></div><div style="clear:both;max-width:100%;position:relative;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">which was 33% higher than the September 2019 quarter. &#160;Wassa continued to deliver mining rates in excess of 4,000 tonnes per day during the current quarter.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">On November 13, 2019, Golden Star reported that it continues to intersect significant higher grade gold mineralization from infill and step out surface drilling on the southern extensions of the Wassa deposit. &#160;A better understanding of the mineralization at depth resulting from this drilling will be incorporated into the ongoing geological interpretation update that will be the basis for Golden Star&#8217;s calendar 2019 year-end mineralized material estimation.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">For calendar 2020, Golden Star expects Wassa to produce between 155,000 and 165,000 ounces, compared to 156,000 gold ounces for calendar 2019. Golden Star expects mining rates to average in excess of 4,000 tonnes per day, as a result of the ongoing development and definition drilling and additional mining fleet.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="background-color:#ffff00;visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="text-decoration:underline;text-decoration-color:#000000;">Royalty Interests</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><i style="font-style:italic;">Cortez </i></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="font-style:italic;visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Production attributable to our royalty interest at Cortez increased to 28,000 ounces of gold for the three months ended December 31, 2019 compared to 19,900 ounces of gold for the three months ended December 31, 2018. The increase was a result of production ramping up at the Crossroads deposit, which is subject to our NVR1C, GSR2 and portions of our NVR1 and GSR3 royalty interests. </p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Barrick reported that Crossroads transitioned from pre-production in the June 2019 quarter to production status in the September 2019 quarter, and leach production has increased as mining and placement of ore from Crossroads has ramped up and more tonnes are placed under solution.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="font-style:italic;visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><i style="font-style:italic;">Pe&#241;asquito </i></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><a id="_Hlk30257049"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Gold, silver and lead production attributable to our royalty interest at Pe&#241;asquito increased approximately 79%, 85% and 71%, respectively, while zinc production decreased approximately 13% when compared to the prior year quarter. &#160;Royalty revenue for the quarter was impacted by a shutdown of mine operations resulting from a blockade of the mine by a trucking contractor and members of the San Juan de Cedros community (one of 25 neighboring communities) that started on September 14, 2019.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><a id="_Hlk30257588"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Newmont reported that the blockade of the Pe&#241;asquito mine was lifted on October 8, 2019, with concentrate shipments resuming immediately thereafter. Newmont further reported that Pe&#241;asquito returned to full operations after a 10-day restart process, which commenced on October 22, 2019. &#160;On December 13, 2019, Newmont also announced that the Pe&#241;asquito mine and the San Juan de Cedros community had agreed to a 30-year infrastructure solution securing sustainable water availability for the community&#8217;s domestic and agricultural uses, which represents a significant milestone and an important step in the on<i style="font-style:italic;">going negotiations between the parties. &#160;</i></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="font-style:italic;visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">For calendar 2020, Newmont expects a full year of operations at Pe&#241;asquito with higher grades, leading to production of an estimated 575,000 ounces of gold, 30 million ounces of silver, 425 million pounds of zinc and 200 million pounds of lead.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><b style="font-weight:bold;">Results of Operations</b></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><a id="_578d8782_ac54_4e78_834d_efb64b9f1d8a"></a><a id="_1811f9fa_80c7_4bf4_a0f4_8bc225322085"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><i style="font-style:italic;">Quarter Ended </i><i style="font-style:italic;">December&#160;31,&#160;2019</i><i style="font-style:italic;">, Compared to Quarter Ended </i><i style="font-style:italic;">December&#160;31,&#160;2018</i></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><a id="_bcc7a0bd_0cd1_43c6_8b2b_0bad57ae59e2"></a><a id="_f930fa82_c2dc_4ae9_976a_3bb193739302"></a><a id="_31ae5bee_dd54_4dc3_afab_1a4a6526dca1"></a><a id="_46ee1e40_96fc_4c0a_935f_1645e89b1f24"></a><a id="_d77fbc45_61d8_4cbb_8088_9641956b97d9"></a><a id="_6def0ab5_f059_4f75_a5f3_9c38e12643a3"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">For the quarter ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019, we recorded net income and comprehensive income attributable to Royal Gold stockholders of $41.3 million, or $0.63 per basic and diluted share, as compared to net income and comprehensive income attributable to Royal Gold stockholders of $23.6 million, or $0.36 per basic and diluted share, for the quarter ended December&#160;31,&#160;2018. &#160;The increase in our earnings per share was primarily attributable to an increase in revenue and a decrease in our interest expense, each discussed further below. &#160;</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><a id="_17d6cbfa_ba99_4918_a7c8_867b12617177"></a><a id="_33c317d9_3be4_45d6_9a9e_21110d57f8bd"></a><a id="_c074dd43_e82b_40ac_b43a_ebaed0a67a1e"></a><a id="_58e17925_4db7_4176_bc30_25c8271a5347"></a><a id="_154822a7_57a0_4944_883a_7c3051aea16f"></a><a id="_31d7e4f0_fbaa_4f42_be3e_a02d11f800f3"></a><a id="_d45fa221_ea73_4491_b108_acf1e00fdfda"></a><a id="_201887df_e6c4_400c_972c_23cc5af401e6"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">For the quarter ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019, we recognized total revenue of $123.6 million, which is comprised of stream revenue of $89.6 million and royalty revenue of $34.0 million at an average gold price of $1,481 per ounce, an average silver price of $17.32 per ounce and an average copper price of $2.67 per pound. &#160;This is compared to total revenue of </p></div><div style="clear:both;display:table;margin-bottom:27.35pt;min-height:36pt;width:100%;"><div style="display:table-cell;vertical-align:bottom;width:100%;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:center;margin:24pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;">26</p></div></div></div>
<div style="background-color:#000000;clear:both;height:2pt;page-break-after:always;width:79.3%;border:0;margin:30pt 10.35% 30pt 10.35%;"></div><div style="max-width:100%;padding-left:10.35%;padding-right:10.35%;position:relative;"><div style="margin-top:21.6pt;min-height:41.75pt;width:100%;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 0pt 30pt 0pt;"><a href="#Toc"><span style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-align:left;">Table of Contents</span></a></p></div><div style="clear:both;max-width:100%;position:relative;min-height:11.5pt;"><a id="_38208ab2_d546_4d1b_8a26_573a7df2d345"></a><a id="_124f73de_aa75_4b6d_9f6d_9e4f13f0d4c4"></a><a id="_16e7791b_fc22_4384_9b16_2a01e51efc7c"></a><a id="_aaff70a6_3c4f_4bdf_a459_eec9f98085b5"></a><a id="_f483f6a6_1dd2_47f9_8ab6_8b903cc331ea"></a><a id="_9f7c3838_ddc9_44f8_a042_c7df17786e71"></a><a id="_a7ec1e48_d3cd_4559_9dc4_14511a733ec7"></a><a id="_db8bb737_b3e7_4e6a_abce_830c62e559cd"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">$97.6 million for the three months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2018, which was comprised of stream revenue of $67.7 million and royalty revenue of $29.9 million, at an average gold price of $1,226 per ounce, an average silver price of $14.54 per ounce and an average copper price of $2.80 per pound. &#160;Revenue and the corresponding production attributable to our stream and royalty interests for the quarter ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019 compared to the quarter ended December&#160;31,&#160;2018 are as follows:</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:center;margin:0pt;">Revenue and Reported Production Subject to Our Stream and Royalty Interests</p><a id="_3498dcc3_c0a3_4fe2_94d7_333dd07cdeee"></a><a id="_000b1ee4_1177_44fa_95aa_0c83383b3606"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:center;margin:0pt;">Quarter Ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019 and 2018</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:center;margin:0pt;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;"> (Amounts in thousands, except reported production ozs. and lbs.) </span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:center;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><a id="_8cfe3b67_b2be_45e8_ba9c_c85bea09f621"></a><a id="_918339bb_555b_4f47_8326_19c33298e739"></a><a id="_dd7d49ef_75c5_45c3_a6c8_43562214a921"></a><a id="_a5254ed7_4a54_4ab0_816e_952010b23be3"></a><a id="_28869670_6cfe_44ff_b061_6546880aae47"></a><a id="_d571e687_10b1_4edc_a1cb_5612b4961864"></a><a id="_3f519284_9f6d_4a9b_8503_5590a3a700d6"></a><a id="_d54fb0d1_50ce_4a93_b615_08d149e63b70"></a><a id="_43889357_d09c_4aff_ada8_45ae85941d21"></a><a Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">The increase in our total revenue for the three months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019, compared with the three months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2018, resulted primarily from an increase in our stream revenue and an increase in the average gold and silver prices. &#160;The increase in our stream revenue was primarily attributable to an increase in gold sales at Andacollo, Pueblo Viejo and Rainy River and higher copper sales at Mount Milligan. &#160;These increases were partially offset by lower gold sales at Mount Milligan primarily due to timing of deliveries. &#160;Please refer to &#8220;Property Developments&#8221; earlier within this MD&amp;A for further discussion on recent developments regarding properties covered by certain of our stream and royalty interests.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p></div><div id="_9ce58a1c_cd34_4789_b1a7_ff2de36fd966"></a><a id="_c194be97_f02a_4244_a4da_a3d21339e24f"></a><a id="_1fcaf51d_abff_42f2_afc6_a5d6464df7b7"></a><a id="_f6a7e5af_75cc_4034_a0dc_eeabf9bda93c"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Cost of sales, which excludes depreciation, depletion and amortization, increased to $21.1 million for the three months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019 from $18.2 million for the three months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2018. The increase was primarily due to increased gold sales at Andacollo and increased gold and silver prices when compared to the prior year quarter. &#160;Cost of sales is specific to our stream agreements and is the result of RGLD Gold AG&#8217;s purchase of gold, silver and copper for a cash payment. &#160;The cash payment for gold from Mount Milligan is the lesser of $435 per ounce or the prevailing market price of gold when purchased, while the cash payment for our other streams is a set contractual percentage of the gold, silver or copper (Mount Milligan) spot price near the date of metal delivery.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><a id="_2a381acf_f3c9_463b_baf6_9310b0e80ca4"></a><a id="_11e875ec_4ff3_413c_8cb8_2219a2346b95"></a><a id="_3f638c08_4ef0_42a7_98f9_3548629a8818"></a><a id="_81480760_ef0f_4aa9_ba62_d9840e035233"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Interest and other expense decreased to $2.2 million for the three months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019, from $7.4 million for the three months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2018. &#160;The decrease was primarily attributable to lower interest expense as a result of a decrease in average debt amounts outstanding when compared to the prior period. &#160;As discussed in our Fiscal 2019 10-K, the Company settled the $370 million aggregate principal amount due under its convertible senior notes that matured in June 2019. &#160;Refer to Note 5 of our notes to consolidated financial statements for further discussion on our outstanding debt. &#160;</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">During the three months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019, we recognized an income tax expense totaling $11.1 million, compared with an income tax benefit of $2.1 million during the three months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2018. &#160;The income tax expense resulted in an effective tax rate of 21.6% in the current period, compared with (10.3%) in the quarter ended December&#160;31,&#160;2018. &#160;The three months ended December 31, 2019 reflected the impacts of additional tax benefits resulting from Swiss Tax Reform. The lower effective tax rate for the three months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2018 was primarily attributable to the Company&#8217;s updated analysis of the tax impacts of the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act (the &#8220;Act&#8221;), considering new U.S. Treasury regulations and IRS guidance released during the period.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><a id="_7a4b85ed_b246_4a4a_82a1_6ba7e32dd155"></a><a id="_f6df08b8_44cb_46fe_97a6_0c146aa2b006"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><i style="font-style:italic;">Six Months Ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019</i><i style="font-style:italic;">, Compared to </i><i style="font-style:italic;">Six Months Ended December&#160;31,&#160;2018</i></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><a id="_a68337af_c70a_44ce_8c3e_c2ae6b44c99f"></a><a id="_79b08647_de16_4a42_ae39_e1999c0779a7"></a><a id="_817d324c_88ae_4eb3_a06f_f9eb1453379d"></a><a id="_804f1bd0_394b_40a4_a5f8_3e25c0394f41"></a><a id="_5e40fd8d_9797_46f4_a072_989383c8b91a"></a><a id="_69fd0f34_74ed_4fa3_b6e7_242d9a0d6423"></a><a id="_ee935bde_9392_4711_a83b_7e73c40e8460"></a><a id="_85ae0937_8745_459c_8dcb_9d43f3ff2912"></a><a id="_820e25ac_8d78_4df0_8030_38e58c9e4829"></a><a id="_dda39193_757f_42ed_814a_33d5413c5da6"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">For the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019, we recorded net income and comprehensive income attributable to Royal Gold stockholders of $111.8 million, or $1.70 per basic and diluted share, as compared to net income and comprehensive income attributable to Royal Gold stockholders of $38.6 million, or $0.59 per basic and diluted share, for the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2018. &#160;The increase in our earnings per share was primarily attributable to (i) an increase in revenue, (ii) a decrease in our interest expense and (iii) discrete income tax benefits recognized, primarily attributable to recent Swiss tax reform during the quarter ended September 30, 2019. Each are discussed further below.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p></div><div style="clear:both;display:table;margin-bottom:27.35pt;min-height:36pt;width:100%;"><div style="display:table-cell;vertical-align:bottom;width:100%;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:center;margin:24pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;">28</p></div></div></div>
<div style="background-color:#000000;clear:both;height:2pt;page-break-after:always;width:79.3%;border:0;margin:30pt 10.35% 30pt 10.35%;"></div><div style="max-width:100%;padding-left:10.35%;padding-right:10.35%;position:relative;"><div style="margin-top:21.6pt;min-height:41.75pt;width:100%;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 0pt 30pt 0pt;"><a href="#Toc"><span style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-align:left;">Table of Contents</span></a></p></div><div style="clear:both;max-width:100%;position:relative;min-height:11.5pt;"><a id="_1dcffbc4_c0d2_46eb_bded_89f14aeea304"></a><a id="_520b0685_664a_4894_97b5_5d115c88fe72"></a><a id="_d6a67dfe_5eed_44b1_b144_3d8b048e1472"></a><a id="_8473e02c_8335_4f40_a07f_7e6cc91ae5f7"></a><a id="_45153683_3e5e_49e4_af67_c889873032e1"></a><a id="_d18eccf9_2871_4665_a43d_393e6b33c648"></a><a id="_441497f4_8896_4dcf_ad2d_405530f5cd0e"></a><a id="_de6a478d_0c10_416f_9384_2d1ed745cfe2"></a><a id="_bd6b805f_6d68_45a8_a178_f8e482daaad1"></a><a id="_55e82335_ff4f_4d25_bf8c_cc15bd4bf72e"></a><a id="_4e8375c5_a860_4898_9c36_6d5317bdfb3d"></a><a id="_c3d5fdaf_7295_4416_991e_3bc5eadd8175"></a><a id="_e7a0166d_116d_441f_bee2_31889bc63bc1"></a><a id="_5c561c84_13be_46f5_a605_93fd8d93b890"></a><a id="_586682b0_9c9d_46a4_91cb_66e3de6b453b"></a><a id="_c9b89ad9_be84_4b7f_a4aa_31b71aae7979"></a><a id="_b92ba8e1_663f_43df_a872_73d0db022e23"></a><a id="_831a5dc8_ac50_4db6_99d7_f56546ff3c4f"></a><a id="_58507aed_4880_4a60_82a4_d22b883dface"></a><a id="_a211a9d0_8bb0_40c1_8ed8_6cef7b6c661e"></a><a id="_2bb68022_5c35_468f_b127_e6fab88b682c"></a><a id="_82f9f94c_80a8_42c8_af16_307f358521e7"></a><a id="_d3fb7703_a4b7_46a8_84a8_7b1175ef2935"></a><a id="_3cb2f164_3f08_403c_a7e8_bb5e92268d92"></a><a id="_55ec7280_e9db_44ee_bac2_b2d9c23e680c"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">For the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019, we recognized total revenue of $242.4 million, which is comprised of stream revenue of $176.6 million and royalty revenue of $65.8 million at an average gold price of $1,477 per ounce, an average silver price of $17.15 per ounce and an average copper price of $2.65 per pound. &#160;This is compared to total revenue of $197.6 million for the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2018, which was comprised of stream revenue of $137.7 million and royalty revenue of $59.9 million, at an average gold price of $1,220 per ounce, an average silver price of $14.78 per ounce and an average copper price of $2.78 per pound. &#160;Revenue and the corresponding production attributable to our stream and royalty interests for the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019 compared to the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2018 are as follows:</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:center;margin:0pt;">Revenue and Reported Production Subject to Our Stream and Royalty Interests</p><a id="_f8099889_72e8_4b2c_8200_3b06c37bf7ec"></a><a id="_60b597ad_39dc_45bc_88ff_9940e7907303"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:center;margin:0pt;">Six Months Ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019 and 2018</p><p metal sales subject to our stream and royalty interests for the </span><span style="font-size:9pt;">six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019</span><span style="font-size:9pt;"> and </span><span style="font-size:9pt;">2018</span><span style="font-size:9pt;">, and may differ from the operators&#8217; public reporting.</span></div><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="font-size:4pt;visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><div style="font-family:'Times New above for further discussion on our principal stream and royalty interests.</span></div><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="font-size:4pt;visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><div style="font-family:'Times New style="display:inline-block;font-size:6.75pt;min-width:18pt;text-indent:0pt;vertical-align:top;white-space:nowrap;">(3)</span><span style="font-size:9pt;">Individually, no stream or royalty included within the &#8220;Other&#8221; category contributed greater than 5% of our total revenue for either period. &#160;</span></div><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="font-size:9pt;visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><a id="_cb639973_f1e7_45c8_aaa9_d9f65219ed9d"></a><a id="_b00d597d_9510_443b_aa3a_87cf85929ad9"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">The increase in our total revenue for the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019, compared with the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2018, resulted primarily from an increase in our stream revenue and an increase in the average gold and silver prices. &#160;The increase in our stream revenue was primarily attributable to an increase in gold and copper sales at Mount Milligan. &#160;These increases were partially offset by lower metal sales at Wassa. &#160;</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p></div><div style="clear:both;display:table;margin-bottom:27.35pt;min-height:36pt;width:100%;"><div style="display:table-cell;vertical-align:bottom;width:100%;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Milligan</p></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;vertical-align:bottom;white-space:nowrap;width:1.7%;margin:0pt;padding:0pt;"><p style="font-family:'Times New style="background-color:#cceeff;vertical-align:bottom;white-space:nowrap;width:13.1%;margin:0pt;padding:0pt;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:9pt;text-align:right;margin:0pt 3pt 0pt 0pt;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;"> 6.8</span></p></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;vertical-align:bottom;white-space:nowrap;width:1.7%;margin:0pt;padding:0pt;"><p style="background-color:#cceeff;vertical-align:bottom;white-space:nowrap;width:9.4%;margin:0pt;padding:0pt;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:9pt;text-align:right;margin:0pt 3pt 0pt 0pt;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;"> 6.7</span></p></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;vertical-align:bottom;white-space:nowrap;width:1.7%;margin:0pt;padding:0pt;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="font-size:9pt;visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;vertical-align:bottom;white-space:nowrap;width:13.1%;margin:0pt;padding:0pt;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:9pt;text-align:right;margin:0pt 3pt 0pt 0pt;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;"> 4.2</span></p></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;vertical-align:bottom;white-space:nowrap;width:1.7%;margin:0pt;padding:0pt;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="font-size:9pt;visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;vertical-align:bottom;white-space:nowrap;width:9.4%;margin:0pt;padding:0pt;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:9pt;text-align:right;margin:0pt 3pt 0pt 0pt;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;"> 3.2</span></p></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;vertical-align:bottom;white-space:nowrap;width:1.7%;margin:0pt;padding:0pt;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="font-size:9pt;visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;vertical-align:bottom;white-space:nowrap;width:13.81%;margin:0pt;padding:0pt;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:9pt;text-align:right;margin:0pt 3pt 0pt 0pt;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;"> 0.9</span></p></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;vertical-align:bottom;white-space:nowrap;width:1.7%;margin:0pt;padding:0pt;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="font-size:9pt;visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;vertical-align:bottom;white-space:nowrap;width:12.91%;margin:0pt;padding:0pt;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:9pt;text-align:right;margin:0pt 3pt 0pt 0pt;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;"> 0.8</span></p></td></tr></table><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><a id="_d638447a_f1db_483f_ba61_1e6d0618a590"></a><a id="_04c2106a_097f_4371_82af_8c81de3eb433"></a><a id="_e00e45ed_4f85_47e1_8db4_bb4abb7600c0"></a><a id="_f30c7bb9_a91c_4f64_93a6_56d223a4816a"></a><a id="_7be6d705_603e_48ec_b2a7_2e7d84b84e9a"></a><a id="_86b3bc2b_8013_4ed0_8024_120af331f7b1"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Cost of sales increased to $41.2 million for the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019 from $34.7 million for the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2018. The increase was primarily due to increased gold and copper sales from Mount Milligan, higher gold sales from Pueblo Viejo and Rainy River, and an increase in gold and silver prices over the prior year quarter. &#160;Cost of sales is specific to our stream agreements and is the result of RGLD Gold&#8217;s purchase of gold, silver and copper for a cash payment. &#160;The cash payment for gold from Mount Milligan is the lesser of $435 per ounce or the prevailing market price of gold when purchased, while the cash payment for our other streams is a set contractual percentage of the gold, silver or copper (Mount Milligan) spot price near the date of metal delivery.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><a id="_f28e0af1_8b87_485d_be29_10da3c0b5393"></a><a id="_9fdf5e35_912d_4471_82ad_84159133c552"></a><a id="_24db950a_cb2b_4bc2_bc5f_a177a1dffaed"></a><a id="_2ff97737_2725_4513_b1a9_841523d93645"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Interest and other expense decreased to $5.1 million for the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019, from $15.3 million for the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2018. &#160;The decrease was primarily attributable to lower interest expense as a result of a decrease in average debt amounts outstanding when compared to the prior period. As discussed in our Fiscal 2019 10-K, the Company settled the $370 million aggregate principal amount due under its convertible senior notes that matured in June 2019. Refer to Note 5 of our notes to consolidated financial statements for further discussion on our outstanding debt.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><a id="_6c20de83_21a2_4432_8a27_c4adba3eae5b"></a><a id="_00ab79f6_cec8_41c6_a658_69af70359562"></a><a id="_0c947443_941e_4b26_8761_b6cc215c41a0"></a><a id="_9a84a0d0_1de2_4138_8bd1_2811cd2009e9"></a><a id="_bcef56e5_0845_48c5_8b6e_943a960a1d5d"></a><a id="_218505fd_0a18_43f2_8f77_361148d43c57"></a><a id="_081a609e_95d3_43ae_b40c_847aa0063c72"></a><a id="_0a4eca70_425d_4de1_a738_174ce08f927c"></a><a id="_957774aa_6206_45ac_a3b5_82f31a3a596e"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">During the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019, we recognized an income tax benefit totaling $12.4 million, compared with an income tax expense of $2.0 million during the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2018.&#160; This resulted in an effective tax rate of (12.8%) in the current period, compared with 5.3% during the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2018. The decrease in the effective tax rate for the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019 was primarily related to the remeasurement of certain deferred tax assets and a net step-up in the basis of tax assets due to the enactment of the Federal Act on Tax Reform and AHV Financing (Swiss Tax Reform). &#160;The effective tax rate for the six months ended December 31, 2018 included an income tax benefit related to the transition tax as part of the Act, which was due to consideration of new U.S. Treasury regulations and IRS guidance released during the period.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><b style="font-weight:bold;">Liquidity and Capital Resources</b></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><i style="font-style:italic;">Overview</i></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><a id="_143431e1_bbe8_4b43_9749_8d93643353a9"></a><a id="_cc2cbe89_9913_443b_b3e6_cacb9250852d"></a><a id="_80b6b8c3_9f0a_41d7_82c7_5055520c894d"></a><a id="_42308dc8_08f5_4cfb_840a_5211802f8dad"></a><a id="_2897251a_1e59_418a_8452_907cf10f06f2"></a><a id="_763ddd4c_8cd4_4387_9434_431e82ef34a6"></a><a id="_7ffd5868_02be_4bbf_9d75_cdc29870cbfe"></a><a id="_b3e72bd6_4684_44c0_b5a6_755d1a1f587d"></a><a id="_39a055ef_c819_4fb5_9f8e_b34c32eeaf95"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">At December&#160;31,&#160;2019, we had current assets of $136.4 million compared to current liabilities of $44.1 million resulting in working capital of $92.3 million and a current ratio of 3 to 1. &#160;This compares to current assets of $154.7 million and current liabilities of $33.6 million at June&#160;30,&#160;2019, resulting in working capital of $121.1 million and a current ratio of approximately 5 to 1. &#160;</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p></div><div style="clear:both;display:table;margin-bottom:27.35pt;min-height:36pt;width:100%;"><div style="display:table-cell;vertical-align:bottom;width:100%;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:center;margin:24pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;">30</p></div></div></div>
<div style="background-color:#000000;clear:both;height:2pt;page-break-after:always;width:79.3%;border:0;margin:30pt 10.35% 30pt 10.35%;"></div><div style="max-width:100%;padding-left:10.35%;padding-right:10.35%;position:relative;"><div style="margin-top:21.6pt;min-height:41.75pt;width:100%;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 0pt 30pt 0pt;"><a href="#Toc"><span style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-align:left;">Table of Contents</span></a></p></div><div style="clear:both;max-width:100%;position:relative;"><a id="_8659131d_1b4d_4f48_a72f_9331f2e35479"></a><a id="_8bd43003_4f3b_4e66_87af_6ea381674650"></a><a id="_418924b0_8ea0_4f0b_a467_e664f752d4d4"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">During the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019, liquidity needs were met from $149.5 million in net cash provided by operating activities and our available cash resources. &#160;During the six months ended December 31, 2019, the Company repaid $85 million of the outstanding borrowings under the revolving credit facility. &#160;As of December&#160;31,&#160;2019, the Company had $135 million outstanding and $865 million available under its revolving credit facility. &#160;Working capital, combined with the Company&#8217;s undrawn revolving credit facility, resulted in approximately $1 billion of total liquidity at December 31, 2019. &#160;The Company was in compliance with each financial covenant under the revolving credit facility as of December&#160;31,&#160;2019. &#160;Refer to Note 5 of our notes to consolidated financial statements for further discussion on our debt.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">We believe that our current financial resources and funds generated from operations will be adequate to cover anticipated expenditures for debt service, general and administrative expense costs and capital expenditures for the foreseeable future. &#160;Our current financial resources are also available to fund dividends and for acquisitions of stream and royalty interests, including the conditional funding schedule in connection with the Khoemac<span style="text-decoration:underline;text-decoration-color:#000000;">a</span>u silver stream acquisition. &#160;Our long-term capital requirements are primarily affected by our ongoing acquisition activities. &#160;The Company currently, and generally at any time, has acquisition opportunities in various stages of active review. &#160;In the event of one or more substantial stream or royalty interest or other acquisitions, we may seek additional debt or equity financing as necessary.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Please refer to our risk factors included in Part&#160;1,&#160;Item 1A of our Fiscal 2019 10-K and in Part&#160;II,&#160;Item 1A of this Quarterly Report on Form&#160;10-Q for a discussion of certain risks that may impact the Company&#8217;s liquidity and capital resources.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><i style="font-style:italic;">Summary of Cash Flows</i></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="text-decoration:underline;text-decoration-color:#000000;">Operating Activities</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><a id="_0624231f_b65e_4e33_b156_352838fc93bc"></a><a id="_1bc92689_7b9a_4475_b3da_ffe673dc15ad"></a><a id="_9499680a_f9ff_4b22_8857_8210be6ca459"></a><a id="_b40d35cb_bf0a_44fa_a516_a6bb38456ae8"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Net cash provided by operating activities totaled $149.5 million for the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019, compared to $103.5 million for the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2018. &#160;The increase is primarily due to an increase in proceeds received from our stream interests, net of cost of sales, of approximately $27.1 million and lower income taxes paid of $10.3 million over the prior period. </p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="text-decoration:underline;text-decoration-color:#000000;">Investing Activities</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><a id="_01a44c95_58e1_4760_9962_6b58dbb899ca"></a><a id="_1aa19ef6_1e2e_471a_a96f_516bd1a6d89a"></a><a id="_e575eec7_2a3b_4fca_9a3f_5834f771d8bc"></a><a id="_b41b1ae7_f4f9_45bc_95e1_f702acdc5b58"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Net cash used in investing activities totaled $68.1 million for the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019, compared to net cash used in investing activities of $3.7 million for the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2018. The increase in cash used in investing activities is primarily due to an increase in the acquisition of stream and royalty interests. In November 2019, the Company made its first advance payment of $65.8 million as part of the Khoemac<span style="text-decoration:underline;text-decoration-color:#000000;">a</span>u silver stream acquisition. </p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="text-decoration:underline;text-decoration-color:#000000;">Financing Activities</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><a id="_013528d3_ebc2_4486_8bb1_36da1fd6cccf"></a><a id="_364367cb_1b9e_494b_a2aa_8b23cbb5d2ba"></a><a id="_435c6a44_b47b_4639_a3dd_341357dc2fde"></a><a id="_81e3e918_d991_4ce9_87db_015ea75cec88"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Net cash used in financing activities totaled $120.4 million for the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019, compared to $32.0 million for the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2018. &#160;The increase in cash used in financing activities is primarily due to an increase in repayments on our revolving credit facility. &#160;The Company repaid $85.0 million on our revolving credit facility during the six months ended December 31, 2019. &#160;</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><b style="font-weight:bold;">Recently Adopted Accounting Standards and Critical Accounting Policies</b></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Refer to Note 1 of our notes to consolidated financial statements for further discussion on any recently adopted accounting standards. &#160;Refer to our Fiscal 2019 10-K for discussion on our critical accounting policies.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p></div><div insolvency proceedings and potential for write-down of Company&#8217;s carrying value for certain non-principal producing properties; expected schedule for making advance payments pursuant to the Khoemac<span style="text-decoration:underline;text-decoration-color:#000000;">a</span>u copper-silver project stream agreement and the funding of such payments; anticipated impact to the Company of the suspension and subsequent resumption of operations at Andacollo; progress of construction, capital committed, forecasted budget and estimated timeframe for first shipment of concentrate at Khoemac<span style="text-decoration:underline;text-decoration-color:#000000;">a</span>u, and size of and conditions to the Company&#8217;s remaining commitment under the Khoemac<span style="text-decoration:underline;text-decoration-color:#000000;">a</span>u stream agreement; expected completion of plant expansion prefeasibility study and feasibility study, and expected increase in throughput and production, at Pueblo Viejo; projected tax benefits; fluctuations in the prices for gold, silver, copper, nickel and other metals; stream and royalty revenue estimates and comparisons of estimates to actual revenue; effective tax rate estimates, including the effect of recently enacted tax reforms; the adequacy of financial resources and funds to cover anticipated expenditures for debt service, general and administrative expenses and dividends, as well as costs associated with exploration and business development and capital expenditures; style="width:36pt;"></td><td style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;vertical-align:text-top;white-space:nowrap;width:18pt;padding:0pt;">&#9679;</td><td style="padding:0pt;"><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-align:justify;">changes in laws governing us, the properties where we hold stream and royalty interests or the operators of such properties;</span></td></tr></table><table style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:0pt;table-layout:fixed;text-align:justify;width:100%;border:0pt;"><tr><td style="width:36pt;"></td><td style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;vertical-align:text-top;white-space:nowrap;width:18pt;padding:0pt;">&#9679;</td><td style="padding:0pt;"><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-align:justify;">risks associated with issuances of additional common stock or incurrence of indebtedness in connection with acquisitions or otherwise including risks associated with the issuance and conversion of convertible notes;</span></td></tr></table><table style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:0pt;table-layout:fixed;text-align:justify;width:100%;border:0pt;"><tr><td style="width:36pt;"></td><td style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;vertical-align:text-top;white-space:nowrap;width:18pt;padding:0pt;">&#9679;</td><td style="padding:0pt;"><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-align:justify;">changes in management and key employees; and</span></td></tr></table><table style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;table-layout:fixed;text-align:justify;width:100%;border:0pt;"><tr><td style="width:36pt;"></td><td style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;vertical-align:text-top;white-space:nowrap;width:18pt;padding:0pt;">&#9679;</td><td style="padding:0pt;"><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-align:justify;">failure to complete future acquisitions;</span></td></tr></table><div style="margin-top:12pt;"></div><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">as well as other factors described elsewhere in this report and our other reports filed with the SEC, including our Fiscal 2019 10-K and subsequent Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q. &#160;Most of these factors are beyond our ability to predict or control. &#160;Future events and actual results could differ materially from those set forth in, contemplated by or underlying the forward-looking statements. &#160;Forward-looking statements speak only as of the date on which they are made. &#160;We disclaim any obligation to update any forward-looking statements made herein, except as required by law. &#160;Readers are cautioned not to put undue reliance on forward-looking statements.</p></div><div style="clear:both;display:table;margin-bottom:27.35pt;min-height:36pt;width:100%;"><div style="display:table-cell;vertical-align:bottom;width:100%;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:center;margin:24pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;">33</p></div></div></div>
<div style="background-color:#000000;clear:both;height:2pt;page-break-after:always;width:79.3%;border:0;margin:30pt 10.35% 30pt 10.35%;"></div><div style="max-width:100%;padding-left:10.35%;padding-right:10.35%;position:relative;"><div style="margin-top:21.6pt;min-height:41.75pt;width:100%;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 0pt 30pt 0pt;"><a href="#Toc"><span style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-align:left;">Table of Contents</span></a></p></div><div style="clear:both;max-width:100%;position:relative;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><a id="_d343d86d_ddf2_492a_bde6_11a233c71ee3"></a><a id="ITEM3QUANTITATIVEANDQUALITATIVEDISCLOSUR"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;padding-left:72pt;text-indent:-72pt;margin:0pt;"><b style="font-weight:bold;">ITEM 3.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DISCLOSURES ABOUT MARKET RISK</b></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Our earnings and cash flows are significantly impacted by changes in the market price of gold and other metals. &#160;Gold, silver, copper and other metal prices can fluctuate significantly and are affected by numerous factors, such as demand, production levels, economic policies of central banks, producer hedging, world political and economic events and the strength of the U.S. dollar relative to other currencies. &#160;Please see &#8220;<i style="font-style:italic;">Volatility in gold, silver, copper, nickel and other metal prices may have an adverse impact on the value of our stream and royalty interests and may reduce our revenues. Certain contracts governing our stream and royalty interests have features that may amplify the negative effects of a decrease in metals prices,</i>&#8221; under Part&#160;I,&#160;Item 1A of our Fiscal 2019 10-K, for more information that can affect gold, silver, copper and other metal prices as well as historical gold, silver, copper and nickel prices.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">During the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019, we reported revenue of $242.4 million, with an average gold price for the period of $1,477 per ounce, an average silver price of $17.15 per ounce and an average copper price of $2.65 per pound. &#160;Approximately 76% of our total reported revenues for the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019 were attributable to gold sales from our gold producing stream and royalty interests, as shown within the MD&amp;A. &#160;For the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019, if the price of gold had averaged 10% higher or lower per ounce, we would have recorded an increase or decrease in revenue of approximately $19.5 million.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Approximately 10% of our total reported revenues for the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019 were attributable to copper sales from our copper producing stream and royalty interests. &#160;For the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019, if the price of copper had averaged 10% higher or lower per pound, we would have recorded an increase or decrease in revenue of approximately $2.7 million.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Approximately 9% of our total reported revenues for the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019 were attributable to silver sales from our silver producing stream and royalty interests. &#160;For the six months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019, if the price of silver had averaged 10% higher or lower per ounce, we would have recorded an increase or decrease in revenue of approximately $2.3 million.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><a id="_3db050fc_f8cf_44ca_b17f_c381c9ef9356"></a><a id="ITEM4CONTROLSANDPROCEDURES_962505"></a><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><b style="font-weight:bold;">ITEM 4.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES</b></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><b style="font-weight:bold;">Evaluation of Disclosure Controls and Procedures</b></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">As of December&#160;31,&#160;2019, the Company&#8217;s management, with the participation of the President and Chief Executive Officer (the principal executive officer) and Chief Financial Officer and Treasurer (the principal financial and accounting officer) of the Company, carried out an evaluation of the effectiveness of the design and operation of the Company&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Rules&#160;13a-15(e)&#160;and 15d-15(e)&#160;of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#8220;Exchange Act&#8221;)). &#160;Based on such evaluation, the Company&#8217;s President and Chief Executive Officer and its Chief Financial Officer and Treasurer have concluded that, as of December&#160;31,&#160;2019, the Company&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures were effective to provide reasonable assurance that information required to be disclosed by the Company in reports that it files or submits under the Exchange Act is recorded, processed, summarized and reported within the required time periods and that such information is accumulated and communicated to the Company&#8217;s management, including the President and Chief Executive Officer and the Chief Financial Officer and Treasurer, as appropriate to allow timely decisions regarding required disclosure.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">Disclosure controls and procedures involve human diligence and compliance and are subject to lapses in judgment and breakdowns resulting from human failures. &#160;As a result, a control system, no matter how well conceived and operated, can provide only reasonable, not absolute, assurance that the objectives of the control system are met. &#160;Further, the design of a control system must reflect the fact that there are resource constraints and the benefits of controls must be considered relative to their costs. &#160;Because of the inherent limitations in all control systems, no evaluation of controls can provide absolute assurance that all control issues and instances of fraud, if any, within the Company have been detected.</p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><b style="font-weight:bold;">Changes in Internal Controls</b></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;">There has been no change in the Company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting during the three months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019 that has materially affected, or that is reasonably likely to materially affect, the Company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting.</p></div><div style="clear:both;display:table;margin-bottom:27.35pt;min-height:36pt;width:100%;"><div style="display:table-cell;vertical-align:bottom;width:100%;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;text-align:center;margin:24pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;">34</p></div></div></div>

style="vertical-align:top;width:1.69%;margin:0pt;padding:0pt;"><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;"><span style="visibility:hidden;">&#8203;</span></p></td><td
